attributes.action: Give Dr A Varma due recognition for starting the prescription pick up programme
attributes.additional_details: This programme has been duplicated nationwide saving patients nationwide a lot of time and inconvenience. Yet Dr Varma has never been recognised for initiating this. We ask that he be fully recognised by the government for this.
attributes.background: In 1977 a pharmacist -Mr Clumpus-in Ormskirk was struggling. The GPs were not sending him prescriptions. He went to see the new GP -Dr Varma -who told him to send someone round to pick up the repeat prescriptions. Patients were told they'd be ready in 2-3 days and loved it. Others followed suit.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for someone to be nominated for an honour. 

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
